title: Challenge:Future 2011

introducer: Nadya Zhexembayeva, IEDC Bled School of Management
moderator: Dan Croitoru, National School of Political Studies and Public Administration
Sayanee Basu, National University of Singapore
author: Carlo Lopez, Universidad Simón Bolívar
Isabella Torrealba Balzán, Universidad Monteávila
Sachi Bansal, Institute of Management & Technology, Faridabad
Nathaniel Spohn, KaosPilots

segmentation: Great pleasure to invite to the stage.
Two young managers to very young, passionate challenge future alumnae who became professional part of Challenge Future team to share with us in a very brief way.
What has been our work in 2011 Scion and Dan.
Hey Dan.
Finally we meet.
I know it's amazing now it has been almost two years since I've met Dan in person.
I have been all around in India and Singapore.
Dan has been all around in Slovenia and Romania.
And guess what?
It didn't feel like so.
In fact, we felt that we have been working together face to face in person every single day.
You know what's funny?
I have the same feeling.
Basically we are working together on the challenge future online platform and we are sharing ideas.
We are connecting, connecting, communicating and it feels like we are in the same room.
Basically she's in one corner of the world.
I'm in another but we are in the same team.
That's right and we are not alone.
In fact we have more than 23,000 community members and challenge future from over 200 countries.
That's right, and that's not more.
And what is our aim exactly in challenge future?
Our aim, our aim is simple to make an impact from local projects to global ones, from helping unprivileged youth to all sorts of other projects.
It's it's a great feeling that's right, and in fact, in terms of action, we have two ways of doing the action.
The very first way.
Is through virtual or online a global teams?
And that's how we do it through action teams.

For example, we have challenged you to write his team that creates virtual or online awareness through weekly articles, and these are use out there that create articles on topics such as sustainability, health or even our collective future.
We are here.
We are a community and we are ready for action.
Basically.
On the other hand, we have this challenge, future chapters and local representatives.
What they do they implement projects locally focused to create local impact and let me give you an example.
The challenge Future chapters network.
They have altogether made a project in order to help unprivileged youth by doing random acts of kindness.
Now, Dan, what if I want to be challenged?
You know all the actions that we talked about.
We want to develop our skills and want to do impact in a better way.
Is there anyway that I can do so?
I think you are referring to the challenge future competitions.
That's right, tell me more you can work on focused topics.
You can resolve real problems and again, let me give you an example we had facing 21st century disasters together with other events at Wrigley off or partner.
Our young community could identify a possible disaster and see what would be possible to prevent this disaster or to adapt to it.
That sounds really familiar.
Another project is youth for Youth Project supported by Studio Moderna and over here the Challenge future use actually create projects for other unprivileged users all across the world.
And definitely I have to mention another one.
Astonishing Slovenia.
We got so many good ideas on how to promote Slovenia and to show the beauty of this country.
And of course our partner, the Slovenian Tourism Office, beautiful Bled in Slovenia.
Beautiful bed definitely.
But Dan look, I really want to make this action like in a team or make it like vigorous in some phases of the competition.
Can I do that?
I think the best thing for you right now would be to get a look at the challenge future main competition because there you and everybody else can join a team, go through different phases.
Judges are evaluating your work community is voting.
What you do basically 600 people.
Took this chance and they are hearing blood.
They are today with us So what more uh-huh an I heard that the theme of the competition was all about fun.
The future of fun.
That's right and meaning Dan if they are in this room I want to hear them and I'm sure the audience wants to hear the medal right.
Damn, take it away.
One group by one group I want to hear all the future of fun and their ideas.
OK, we have five teams not only from different countries but from different continents.
I would like to start with first team team Depatie from Venezuela.
So.
We are again very very.
We are going to speak very fast because we have only three minutes so.
Have you ever seen a computer reminding us that we are forgetting?
Anne.
What we want to do is to create a system that helps people learn more efficiently so we can impact in the educational attainment in the society.
What we did was a shift of the model to come up with with the system.
An.
I mean that's a desktop system, laptop or hologram there in 2003.
That body means of this operating system is able to remind us that we are about to forget.
And actually it will teach us how to use our memory more efficiently.
Almost all the time we used to come the computers the other way to remind us when we have already forgotten a lot.
So, um, great effort has been invested to include more people in education system, although the numbers doesn't show the exclusion is decreasing.
It has just been passed in some places just in the night is a whole industry devoted to the occasional games fail.
Trying to offer games based in question and answers.
A solution that wasn't very fun.
So far along time people have been trying to solve this problem with the same model.
Let's try new things.
The system will also be able to measure statistics about performance of the students both.
But most importantly, this system will be able to help the student every time and everywhere, helping them remember what they learn, and fostering creativity and collaboration skills.
Well, I hope you all understand a little of what we make.
We are not very good with English so we could we had to relive it so well.
Thanks a lot.
I hope you all enjoy.
Now we shift.
We move from Venezuela all the way to Russia and team rush, huh?
Silly brains, yorgey, Natalia and Olga.
Thanks for the opportunity to speak in front of change makers and makers of Changemakers.
I have only one minutes, so I'll be as fast as rabbit I idea of our project is to create a common platform for action to Unite Frontiers, business and church organizations at the level of Fun City.
This project is designed to solve 2 social problems.
First, we want to make non profit organizations to realize that they are also a market and so that should act like a business unit with marketing with management and this focus on product.
Second, we want to change the veneration of social volunteering.
From the hard feelings to the positive emotions of joy fan and gaming.
To do so, we started developing this project, this website.
This website is a mix of social network and massive multiplayer online game.
So this is the idea of this project is to arrange social volunteering events in a spirit of gaming.
So as any game it has its heroes, our community.
It has its quest to be completed.
Is this is social events and it has three votes to be gained.
This revolts opportunity to entertain Munyer City and to become a part of society.
After you complete some questions and map of the city.
For instance, go somewhere and help someone and participate in someone to an event.
So this project also has opportunities for business and charity organizations to promote themselves to take part in solving social problems.
I rarely run out of time, so just let me give you a promise that if this project is implemented, it will really transform the volunteer and into the permanent Feast of joy.
Thank you.
Be kind with fun in mind.

And before you go, I have one question for you because we have to remind our audience that the funding challenge future comes with a grand award of several figures and I would like to ask you how funny would that be through extremely funny?
And what's more important, you will enjoy responsibly.
Thank you very much.
The next team.
The next team comes from India.
Saatchi Bonsall and Upper vagina Saatchi Gandhi has said every human being comes here for a purpose and he shall do it by returning it to the society by doing something for the society.
Now it's time for the technology to do something for underprivileged kids and disabled people.
Here a child is standing in front of the screen.
Whatever motion the child will do would be detected by the screen and it would behave like a teacher would reply like a teacher he can select and it will tell whether it is right or it is not.
So this is our idea and we want to focus on India because out of 22 disabled million persons in India 14 million are illiterate as well as unemployed.
Thank you.
Sachin.
One question for you.
Also how many?
People how many young children have you impacted so far?

Because I know you have done a lot of a lot of things so far, and there are two 50 underprivileged kids we're working with them from the past three years and we have also helped 600 blind people, congratulations.
The next team comes from Canada.
Nats.
Soon.
A man with an impact wherever he goes.
Hello everybody.
In 2009, I got the fortunate opportunity to attend the Copenhagen Climate conference.

Probably like some of you here up front and after the conference I thought that we need to get better at innovative problem solving an at having strong motivation and that the next generation needs to develop that capacity.

And so I took the game dynamics, which I thought were pretty interesting of the Copenhagen climate conference and transposed it on the theory of planetary boundaries, which is developed by scientists named.
Johan Rockstrom Anna number of other leading scientists in the world and is this theory.

the UN is looking at it currently to use it as the foundation for their new plan for sustainable future because it isolates the nine natural systems that are essential for the planet's health and defines quantifiable boundaries within which we have to stay.
And so I've created this game and I played it with a lot of young people who become fired up, engaged and gain a really comprehensive understanding very quickly.
Of the environmental crisis and hopefully know for sure I will take this game and make it available to young people in school systems around the world.
Nat.
Don't go away a question for you as well.
You were mentioning Mr. Johan rockstrom.
I know he's the director of the Stockholm Resilience Centre, an also member of different organizations.
You are using his theory.
Did you get in contact with him so far?
Yes I met with Johan Rockstrom.
He's the he's also the chief Sustainability advisor to banking the Secretary General of the UN, among with a number of other advisors met with him in London.
And he really loved the idea of the game and said that.
Changing the mindset in the consciousness of young people is a gradual but very important transformation to happen.
Congratulations Matt, thank you very much.
And we have a fifth team.
That unfortunately, the founder was not able to be here today because of visa issues, but I will take one minute to present the solution.
It is called.
We built Africa.
It is a social enterprise where other mafia.
This is her name, the founder.
She creates change by reusing and redesigning the market stalls.
As you can see in this picture.
Basically by reordering.
The design of IT revenues are increasing.
People get to buy more and sell more.
And all this is being done using reusable materials.
Everything is easy to set up.
It takes just one day to produce and everything is based on prefabricated product which fit together like Lego thing.
So let's give it an applause for adima.
Thank you so much, Dan and.
I'm sure with so many ideas in the next one year or two years when we have the next summit will be wowed with how many of them have been implemented and impacted the Utes and world.
Thank you so much.
More challenge, future.
